question: During your golf round, your ball comes to rest against a rake in a bunker. According to the rules of golf, what should you do?*

choices.text: Play the ball as it lies without moving the rake.
Move the rake and if the ball moves, place it back where it was without penalty.
Take a penalty stroke and drop the ball outside the bunker.
Move the rake and if the ball moves, add a penalty shot to your score

explanation: In this situation, the rake is considered a movable obstruction. According to the rules, you are allowed to move the obstruction (the rake). If the ball moves as a result of moving the obstruction, there is no penalty, but you must replace the ball to its original position before the obstruction was moved.
